Meaning: the ninth day of the month
to line up, to set up, to arrange in a line
to line up, to stand in a line
to joke,  to jest, to kid,  to make fun of
to state, to speak, to mention, to relate
deep (colour), dark, strong (flavour, smell, etc.), dense
amount necessary to fill a container
calling on someone who is ill
to hit, to expose, to apply, to hold on
to be hit, to be strike, to be in contact
to be violated, to be corrupted
